alert.note: Alert for Pima (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 10 at 9:51PM MST until August 10 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN PIMA COUNTY... At 951 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain has ended. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.3 inches are possible in the warned area as additional showers and thunderstorms are likely over the next hour. Finger Rock Wash has seen rapid rises, peaking at 8 feet. This has closed some roads in the area. Use caution traveling and avoid these areas. Flows will continue down the wash emptying into the Rillito. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Catalina Foothills. This includes the following streams and drainages... Rillito River and Esperero Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
